title: Drawing, "Landscape with Mount Purese, Colombia", August 6, 1853
medium: Graphite, brush and oxidized white gouache on buff-colored paper.
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, with figures and various locations:  Clouds / rich green / warm / rock and trees / wheat / wheat bluish / trees / warm / gray rock / grass / rocks / maize / Bushes / rich green, deep / mid green / solitary / very light / beautifu green / rocks projecting / growth scanty / foreground; and at top right:  6 Rock and vegetation / general effect warm/ Purese Aug.  6 - / 53 / 2 salmon color light / 3 grey / 4 wheat rich green / 5 small (over scanty) growth but / rich in green / Broken into masses of / trees bare soil bushes / grass and presenting a variety of green tints; and again at bottom center: the East direction.
description: Horizontal view showing the banks of a deeply cut valley leading toward the back at the left and a plateau at the right, with a village in the middle distance, as the mountain rises in the center, at the rear.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Landscape with Mount Purese, Colombia", August 6, 1853.
August 6, 1853. Graphite, brush and oxidized white gouache on buff-colored paper.. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-90.
